title: How come Akali, with impunity, can stand on top of minios and spam Q on me
body: And straight up just dps me down with “poke.” Why is it that Akali can literally bully Olaf, Renekton, etc? You don’t even have to play this champion, she is so damn fail-safe. That wouldn’t bother me so much if she didn’t have the capacity to not only win lane, but dominate it with ease. This champion needs to be deleted and just start over.

"Every other champion has 1 item that makes them less useful" that is not true at all. 
{{champion:81}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:141}} I can't think of one item that could completely counter these champions. 

There are several champions who don't have items designated to counter them and saying "Zhonyas" to everyone I could possibly list is a poor excuse  and can be just as argued for against Akali. 
She doesn't dictate anything unless she lands her E. If you can't dodge one skill shot, then that's not the champions fault. That's like arguing that Lux's kit is an issue because she lands 1 q and you insta-die to her Q+E+R combo, you didn't dodge Lux's q. 

Also, the whole point of building items in this game is to counterplay people. If you lack a tank on your team to go against an Akali or your players don't choose to CC her, then your entire team of squishy champs is probably gonna die. Top lane was meant for tanks/bruisers... not this current bs where ADCS and AP mages are topping. It's part of the reason the meta is so ridiculous. 

Also, she is an assassin, if you are soloing against her, you are likely to die. The assassins main focus is to flank the enemy back line (Squishy champions), and if you have no front line while facing her in lane, you have a less likely chance to win trades. 

What will be solution to her kit, even without removing her R STUN, Obscurity, or her q heal is to remove the extended range on her passive and the movement speed she receives when it activates. That's the only thing in her kit that I see problematic.

Her Q is fine. I think Akali's main problem is that she is designed to have a really slow kill time for an assassin. However, because she is squishy too, they needed to give her a lot of all-around damage and utility to make her viable in average play. 

Personally, I would change her R1 to be targeted, but only damage the target. Additionally, move some damage from R2 to R1. That increases her single target pressure and reduces her aoe damage.

Her only issue in my opinion is the movement speed buff she gets from her passive. When she leaves the ring, she jumps up almost 100 more movement speed. That sets her to boots standard where she's able to constantly poke the enemy with ease. Her heal in her q, shroud obsure, or ult stun was not the issue.

She still needs to break the ring to proc the passive. It's part of her design to weave in and out. 

Without the movement speed, it would be extremely difficult to proc unless the circle diameter was reduced to compensate.

Not saying Akali isn't broken or straight up dumb to fight especially if the Akali player is really good... But pretty sure Akali can only "spam" Q about two times then either waste shroud or sit around for energy to build.

She needs less burst and more sustain. Akali currently straddles the line between assassin and skirmisher, and the extreme safety of her shroud simply is not balance-able on an assassin. Akali has too much mobility and burst to be a true skirmisher, yet the iconic things about her kit are the things that don't belong on an assassin. Being a squishy champion with a powerful defensive tool that lets you stand in teamfights and chase your targets to the ends of the earth is what _skirmishers_ do, not assassins. 

Nerf her Q damage and increase the cooldown (2 seconds?), but have her passive-empowered autos give her more energy and a small heal. Make her R1 targeted, but bring back the stun and let her hold the button to vault up to 300 units past the target, even at max range. 

Boom. Akali is a skirmisher. Her burst would be much lower, but she'd have much more sustained damage. She'd need to commit to auto attacking and weaving in and out of her passive circles to keep dealing damage, but it would take her much longer to run out of gas. Having her R1 be targeted with the extra vault forces her to use it as an engage only, but it lines up a perfect Q for her. She would be a mobile and persistent attacker that could chase down a single target forever.
